info.title: YellowPages API
info.description: The YP Developer Program provides open APIs to access listings data, user ratings, coupons, and functionality such as local search and mapping.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired format of the response. Possible values: xml and json. Defaults to xml.

parameters.name: searchloc
parameters.description: Unparsed, user-entered search location. Please ensure that all values are URL encoded.Valid inputs are:- city, state (example: searchloc=Glendale%2C+CA).- zip code (example: searchloc=91203).- lat:long (example: searchloc=37.7752%3A-122.4192 for San Francisco,CA).- street1 and street2, city, state (example: searchloc=olive+and+san+fernando%2C+burbank+CA).- street1 and street2, zip (example: searchloc=olive+and+san+fernando%2C+91502).- street, zip (example: searchloc=611+North+Brand%2C+91203).- s

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: Unparsed, user-entered search term. Note: For applications where users may provide the search term and location in a single input field (e.g. pizza, Los Angeles), the user-entered value can be sent in the term parameter thus avoiding the need to parse the term and location on the client side.

parameters.name: searchloc
parameters.description: Unparsed, user-entered search location. Please ensure that all values are URL encoded.Valid inputs are:- city, state (example: searchloc=Glendale%2C+CA).- zip code (example: searchloc=91203).- lat:long (example: searchloc=37.7752%3A-122.4192 for San Francisco,CA).- street1 and street2, city, state (example: searchloc=olive+and+san+fernando%2C+burbank+CA).- street1 and street2, zip (example: searchloc=olive+and+san+fernando%2C+91502).- street, zip (example: searchloc=611+North+Brand%2C+91203).- s

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired format of the response. Possible values: xml and json. Defaults to xml.

parameters.name: listingid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the business listing.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: User agent.

parameters.name: image_format
parameters.description: String representing the mime-type of map you want returned. Valid values: jpg, png and gif.

parameters.name: listingid
parameters.description: YP listing ID.

parameters.name: pan_horizontal
parameters.description: A positive or negative number reflecting the percentage of the map image to pan west (negative) or east (positive). (Default = 0). Examples: 0.5 (50% east) -0.4 (40% west). Postiive numbers tilt to the north, negative numbers tilt to the south.

parameters.name: pan_vertical
parameters.description: A positive or negative number reflecting the percentage of the map image to pan south (negative) or north (positive). (Default = 0). Examples: 0.5 (50% north) -0.4 (40% south). Postiive numbers tilt to the north, negative numbers tilt to the south.

parameters.name: pixel_height
parameters.description: Integer representing the height in pixels of the map (Default = 400). Examples: 400, 200, 123.

parameters.name: pixel_width
parameters.description: Integer representing the width in pixels of the map (Default = 400). Examples: 400, 200, 123.

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: Sets the zoom factor for the map, expressed as a fraction from .1 to 1.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired format of the response. Possible values: xml and json. Defaults to xml.

parameters.name: listingid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the business listing.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired format of the response. Possible values: xml and json. Defaults to xml.

parameters.name: listingcount
parameters.description: Total number of listings to return. Defaults to 5.

parameters.name: pagenum
parameters.description: The page index of the block of results to return. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: phonesearch
parameters.description: Indicates that the term parameter contains a phone number, formatted as a 10-digit integer, e.g. 8775551212.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Maximum search radius (in miles) from center of target location for Organic Results (only).

parameters.name: searchloc
parameters.description: Unparsed, user-entered search location. Please ensure that all values are URL encoded. If no value is passed for searchloc, then the search engine will attempt to find a valid geo location string in the term parameters value.Valid inputs are:- city, state (example: searchloc=Glendale%2C+CA).- zip code (example: searchloc=91203).- lat:long (example: searchloc=37.7752%3A-122.4192 for San Francisco,CA).- street1 and street2, city, state (example: searchloc=olive+and+san+fernando%2C+burbank+CA).- s

parameters.name: shorturl
parameters.description: Enables short URL formats in the API response. Typically only used for SMS applications. Set to true for short URL format. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Select the sort criteria for Organic Listings (only).Valid inputs are:- distance: Sort results by distance.- name: Sort results alphabetically by name.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: Unparsed, user-entered search term. Note: For applications where users may provide the search term and location in a single input field (e.g. pizza, Los Angeles), the user-entered value can be sent in the term parameter thus avoiding the need to parse the term and location on the client side. To make this work, do not send a value for searchloc.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: User agent.
